description.label: Description
description.value: A rowlock is a kind of bracket that holds an oar on a rowing vessel. Most are either C-shaped wooden stops built into the gunwale or U-shaped iron fittings that swivel with the oar’s movement. In either case, an oar can come out of its rowlock if a Row Test is failed, taking one action to replace it before rowing can resume. Closed rowlocks solve this problem. The oar may be threaded through a hole in the gunwale, or lashed to a standard rowlock with leather straps, but in either case it physically cannot come out.
